problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following is correct with regards to the nucleus?
options: Hepatocytes are multinucleated due to cytokinesis failure
Red blood cells are anucleated, to maximize space for hemoglobin
Skeletal muscle cells are multinucleated due to the fission of cells
Sieve tube element cells have a nucleus
problems.hint: There is no such thing as fission of cells
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option B, red blood cells DO NOT have a nucleus to ensure that there is maximal space for hemoglobin. The more hemoglobin, the more oxygen it can carry. Option A is incorrect because hepatocytes are BINUCLEATED due to cytokinesis failure.  Option C is incorrect because skeletal muscle cells are multinucleated due to the fusion, not fission of cells. Option D is incorrect because sieve tube elements DO NOT have a nucleus, they rely on companion cells for metabolic needs.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Fill in the blanks:
options: Heterochromatin; euchromatin
Euchromatin, heterochromatin
Chromochroid, chromatin
Chromatid; chromochroid
problems.hint: There is no such thing as chromochroid.
problems.detailed: The correct answer here is option A. Heterochromatin is indeed non-transcriptable, extremely condensed. Euchromatin is transcriptable and less condensed.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Choose the INCORRECT answer with regards to the cytoskeleton:
options: Microtubules are the thickest of the three cytoskeletal components
Microfilaments are the thinnest of the three cytoskeletal components, made of tubulin
Intermediate filaments have a thickness between that of microtubules and microfilaments
Microtubules provide structural support
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option B. Microfilaments are made of actin, NOT tubulin.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Choose the CORRECT answer with regards to chloroplasts:
options: Thylokoids are stacks of granum, containing chlorophyll
The stroma is the site of gas exchange, stomata is the fluid-filled space within the chloroplast
Chloroplasts have their own circular DNA
Chloroplasts do not support the endosymbiotic theory
problems.hint: The stomata is the side of gas exchange
problems.detailed: The correct answer is C. Chloroplasts have their own circular DNA, which is one reason why option D is wrong, because chloroplasts support the endosymbiotic theory. Option A is incorrect because thylakoid grana are stacks of thylakoids. The stomata is the site of the gas exchange, the stroma is the fluid-filled space within the chloroplast, where the Calvin cycle occurs.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question:
Which of the following is CORRECT?
i) Vacuoles are permanently found in plants, fungi, and algae (green protists)
ii) Ribosomes have a membrane and they function in protein synthesis
iii) Mitochondria are found in both aerobic and anaerobic cells
iv) The cytoplasm resembles a colloidal solution
options: i, iv, iii
i, ii
ii, iii
i, iv
problems.hint: Ribosomes do not have a membrane
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option D. (i) is correct, because PERMANENT vacuoles are found in plants, fungi, and algae. (ii) is incorrect, ribosomes DO NOT have a membrane. (iii) is incorrect, mitochondria are ONLY found in aerobic cells. Option (iv), is correct, the cytoplasm resembles a colloidal solution.
